author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
I noticed that you included some files verbatim from gmsh which is GPL licensed (https://github.com/shipengcheng1230/GmshTools.jl/blob/master/test/t1.jl vs https://gitlab.onelab.info/gmsh/gmsh/blob/master/demos/api/t1.jl etc). I think it would be nice if you added a comment about this e.g. in the LICENSE file, and at the top of those copied files. IANAL but seems like you should at least acknowledge the original source here.

Also, https://github.com/shipengcheng1230/GmshTools.jl/blob/f6ea5a98b8f43d9b847107c024e234c53e0411fa/src/GmshTools.jl#L9 seems like a really bad idea, but we don't have to discuss that here.
I am not sure you necessarily have to license your package under GPL, just the copied files. But again, IANAL and it would be nice if anyone else could comment, I don't really know.

@fredrikekre After viewing this [post](https://discourse.julialang.org/t/gpl-and-virality/7715/17) and find an example of FFTW.jl (mit license, fftw is GPLv2), I decided to remove the shipped codes and change back to MIT license.
Hi @StefanKarpinski, it's been quiet for a while and is there anything I should change if I may ask? Really appreciated for your review. Thanks!

I've created release `v0.1.0`, [here](https://github.com/shipengcheng1230/GmshTools.jl/releases/tag/v0.1.0) it is.
<!-- cedd0d30-7b0f-11e9-9bcb-5dde68c4ba64 -->
